guide.introduction: This uses an oil lamp as the heat source to make your food cook.
guide.introduction_rendered:
This uses an oil lamp as the heat source to make your food cook.

Relevant parts
  • Soda cans
  • Cotton string
  • Paper clip
  • Olive oil
  • Uncooked food
Tools
  • Hot Glue gun & hot glue
  • Lighter
  • Utility knife

parts.notes: you will need some kind of food that will be able to cook over aluminum cookware such as eggs

lines.text: Cut the bottoms off of the cans like so. One will be the lamp, and the other can will be the cookware a.k.a. the pot. Shape the paper clip so that it will stand up on Its own like shown. Wrap the string around the paper clip and this is our wick. Hot glue this in the bottom of the can. Fill the can up with oil.
lines.text_raw: Cut the bottoms off of the cans like so. One will be the lamp, and the other can will be the cookware a.k.a. the pot. Shape the paper clip so that it will stand up on Its own like shown. Wrap the string around the paper clip and this is our wick. Hot glue this in the bottom of the can. Fill the can up with oil.

lines.text: Put your food into the bottom of the second can (the one you didn't put the wick in). Hold it over the flame untill it cooks. Here I used a couple of eggs and it turned out delicious! My eggs took about 5-7 minutes to cook. Your time it takes may depend on how much food you put in there and a few more factors.
